heaviest_rainfall.status: The largest amount of rain ever recorded is on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm fell at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour over the 37.2 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: On 02 September 2025, the rain fell at an exceptional rate, peaking at 27.0mm per hour, the heaviest downpour recorded.  A total of 21.19mm fell over the 15.0 hour storm.

longest_rain.status: The lengthiest precipitation event recorded spanned 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025, it was characterized by a peak rain intensity of 4.6mm per hour and a total rainfall of 36.8mm.

most_lightning.status: Since records began on 11 April 2025, the highest lightning strike count in one day is 23 on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: Currently no stormy weather.  The most recent storm happened on 21 September 2025 and it lasted for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is currently no cold snap.  This year there have been 6 cold snaps, usually there are 3.7 cold snaps per year.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference is 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwaves.status: There is not an active heatwaves.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and it has only happened 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (188°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The highest wind gust ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 2.8°C), outside temperature (down 2.4°C), and inside temperature (down 2.3°C).

The past week and month had observable variation in dew point temperature (up 50.6°C), feels like temperature (up 55.3°C), outside temperature (up 52.6°C), and cloud levels (down 293 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 395.2m lower than yesterday, 417.5m higher than the past week, 293.4m higher than the past month.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 1176m and a peak of 4770m, averaging 2090m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.
cloud levels.summary: Clouds will be high, allowing good sunlight.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures should be quite comfortable. Outside; mild and pleasant. Also, dry and less humid conditions and very little to no wind will be present. Chance of light rain, clouds will be high, allowing good sunlight, and strong and powerful sunlight. Weather should be calm and steady.
